context_0.vignette: Heinz's wife has recently fallen ill and needs an expensive medication that is not covered by her medical insurance. They do not have the money needed to purchase the expensive prescription medication, but they know that it is vital for her to have it if she is going to recover.
context_0.prompt: One thing that Heinz could do is to
generation: seek financial assistance through various outlets
approach the pharmaceutical company directly and explain the situation, asking if they can offer the medication at a discounted price or on a payment plan
seek financial aid from family, friends or charities

discuss payment plans or financial assistance with the pharmacy or drug company, appeal to the insurance company to reconsider its decision, or try fundraising through community support or crowdfunding platforms
approach various charitable organizations or health foundations that specialize in providing financial assistance for medical treatment, prescription drugs, and related needs

explore various options such as speaking with the doctor about any possible alternatives or cheaper versions of the medication, setting up a fundraising campaign through social media or websites like GoFundMe, applying for medical assistance through various charities or non-profit organizations, or speaking with a social worker or hospital financial counselor about possible options
approach various pharmaceutical assistance programs or charities that may be able to provide the medication at a reduced cost or free of charge
apply for assistance programs, such as patient assistance programs (PAPs) that pharmaceutical companies often have in place
seek assistance from charitable organizations or foundations that provide financial aid to those who cannot afford their prescription medications
appeal to charities, foundations, or relevant social organizations for financial assistance

context_1.vignette: Josh is on the way to the airport to catch a flight for a hunting safari in Africa. He leaves with plenty of time to make it there, but his car breaks down on the highway. Now Josh is sitting in his car near a busy intersection, and knows he needs to get to airport soon if he is going to catch his flight.
context_1.prompt: One thing that Josh could do is to
generation: call a taxi, Uber, or another ride-service to get him to the airport as fast as possible
call a cab or an Uber to take him to the airport and arrange for his car to be towed later
call a taxi, an Uber, or any other ride-sharing service to quickly get him to the airport
call for a taxi, rideshare service, or roadside assistance to help him reach the airport on time
call for a taxi, an Uber, or any other ride service
call a taxi, uber, or any other ride-hailing service to take him to the airport
call a taxi or a rideshare service like Uber or Lyft
call a taxi, Uber, or any other ride-hailing service to take him to the airport
call a taxi, Uber, or any other rideshare service to take him to the airport
call a taxi, Uber, or a friend for a ride to the airport

context_2.vignette: Brian is the evening manager at a bakery. Near the end of the day, he realizes that $50.75 is missing from the register and that he is responsible for accounting for the money at the end of the day. Brian knows he has to make sure the register is balanced or he might lose his job.

generation: replace the missing amount from his own pocket
put his own money in the register to balance out the missing amount
add his own money to the register to make up for the missing amount
contribute his own money to balance the register for that day

pay the missing amount from his own pocket to balance the register
take money out of his own pocket to replace the missing money
put $50
use his own money to cover the missing amount
pay out of his own pocket to cover the missing amount

context_4.vignette: Mary is about to go to her final class of the day when she remebers that there is a homework assignment that is due. Mary's mom accidentally took her homework assignment out of her backpack when she was making room for her lunch. Now Mary has nothing to turn in for credit.
context_4.prompt: One thing that Mary could do is to
generation: explain the situation to her teacher, apologize for the mistake, and ask if she could hand in the assignment the following day or send it digitally
explain the situation to her teacher and ask for an extension to turn in the assignment
explain the situation to her teacher and ask for an extension, promising to bring the homework the next day
immediately call or text her mom to explain the situation
ask her teacher for an extension, explaining the situation and offering to bring the assignment the next day
explain the situation to her teacher and ask for an extension to submit the homework
explain the situation to her teacher and ask for an extension
call her mom and ask if she could bring the assignment to the school
explain the situation to her teacher immediately, including the part about her mother accidentally taking out her homework from her backpack
try to explain the situation to her teacher and ask for an extension

context_5.vignette: Brad and some friends are hiking through the mountains in the Canadian wilderness. A couple of days into their hike, Brad realizes that they are lost. He knows that a rescue crew could arrive before long, but it is extremely cold and they don't have much food or water left.
context_5.prompt: One thing that Brad could do is to
generation: create signals for help using the resources they have available
start a fire to keep themselves warm, melt snow for drinking water, and signal for help
find a sheltered area to set up camp and start a fire for warmth
start a fire not only for warmth but also as a signal for any nearby rescue teams
start a fire to stay warm and to signal the rescue crew
start finding ways to survive until help arrives
start a survival camp until rescuers arrive
start creating signals for potential rescuers such as a fire, symbols in the snow or ways to make noise
use his survival skills, by seeking shelter, gathering firewood, melting snow for drinking water, and trying to track or search for edible plants and bugs for food
gather his team and discuss the situation
